intro: Rhynchopera aggeris, commonly known as the sandspit grass, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in salt marshes or near the shoreline. Its inflorescence consists of dense, spike-like clusters of small, inconspicuous flowers. Rhynchopera aggeris plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and providing habitat for various small organisms.
